Prehistory is the time before history. It starts from the earliest humans and ends when people start writing things down. This period covers millions of years. In prehistory, humans lived as hunters and gatherers. They didn't have books or schools. Instead, they passed down knowledge through stories and traditions. Archaeologists study this time by finding and examining old tools, art, and buildings. They help us understand how our ancestors lived and what they did.
